document_data.mainbody: '''''Deep red ioun stones''''' were highly sought-after [[enchanted]] gems that circled their master's head and granted them increased dexterity.
document_data.Description: ''[[Ioun stone]]s'' possessed different shapes, colors, and properties. These deep red round and polished gems resembled droplets of dried blood.
document_data.Powers: Once activated, these magic stones floated around their owner's head. ''Deep red ioun stones'' enchanted their owner's dexterity,
document_data.History:
One ''deep red ioun stone'' of note was created by a [[gnome|gnomish]] master [[thief]] sometime before [[1281 DR]]. His ''ioun stone'', along with the gnome's skull remnants, was retrieved from inside a [[giant clam]] in the [[Sea of Swords]], off the [[Sword Coast]]. Since then that stone changed many owners, including hunters, weavers, and even one especially narcissistic [[harp]]ist. By 1281 DR, this ''deep red ioun stones'' was in possession of an evil [[necromancer]] [[Presio]] who served [[Yxunomei]] in her lair within the  [[Dragon's Eye]]on the [[Spine of the World]]. After Presio's death, the ''stone'' was picked up by the heroes of [[Icewind Dale]].

In [[1358 DR]], a ''deep red ioun stone'' could be found within a deadly [[ghost]]-infested ruined [[Valhingen Graveyard]] of [[Old Phlan]].

Notable Owners.Individuals: *[[Thogaf]]: a [[wizard]] who found himself imprisoned in the [[Fortress of the Five Vultures]] in [[Calaunt]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite card/AD&D Trading Cards/1992|549|Thogaf}}
Notable Owners.Organizations: *[[Fire Knives]]: in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], a ''deep red ioun stone'' was part of the Assassin's Guild's treasure trove underneath the city of [[Tilverton]].
